abstractText: A common for estimating the age of a fish is to examine the fine ridges on a scale (called circuli) that are laid down in a circular pattern as the fish grows. Scale samples are often collected from samples of fish within a population to estimate age composition. NOAA recommends that to demonstrate ESU/DPS viability, annual documentation of a variety of biological parameters (including adult abundance, age distribution, sex ratio, length, and run timing) is needed at the population, major population grouping, and ESU/DPS level for each listed species (Crawford and Rumsey 2011). Detailed instructions for this method are provided below.
title: Mounting scales for aging v1.0
